QCAlgorithm provides a shortcut method, APS, for the AugenPriceSpike indicator. It creates an Indicator object, sets up a consolidator to update the indicator, and then returns the indicator so you can use it in your algorithm.

The following reference table describes the APS method:

APS()1/1

            AugenPriceSpike QuantConnect.Algorithm.QCAlgorithm.APS (
    Symbol                       symbol,
    *Int32                       period,
    *Nullable<Resolution>  resolution,
    *Func<Decimal>         selector
   )

Creates an AugenPriceSpike indicator for the symbol. The indicator will be automatically updated on the given resolution.

Parameters
Symbol symbol The symbol whose APS we want.
*Int32 period (Optional) The period of the APS.
*Nullable<Resolution> resolution (Optional) The resolution.
*Func<Decimal> selector (Optional) Selects a value from the BaseData to send into the indicator, if None defaults to the Value property of BaseData (x => x.Value).

Return

AugenPriceSpike - The AugenPriceSpike indicator for the given parameters

Definition at line 330 of file Algorithm/QCAlgorithm.Indicators.cs.


The resolution of the indicator should be greater than or equal to the resolution of the security. For instance, if you subscribe to hourly data for a security, you should update its indicator with data that spans 1 hour or longer.

To retrieve the numerical value of the indicator, use its Current.Value attribute.

private AugenPriceSpike _aps;

// In Initialize()
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
_aps = APS(symbol);

// In OnData()
if (_aps.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _aps.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.aps = self.APS(symbol)

# In OnData()
if self.aps.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.aps.Current.Value
